titlestmt.subtitle: Finding Aid
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Amy Hague

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in NoteTab Pro. Encoded by Annie-Sage Whitehurst. 2009-06-23

did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: Periodicals Collection includes over 1,500 titles of current and historical, U.S. and international women's magazines, newsletters, and other serials. Holdings range from full-runs to single subscriptions for certain titles.

daodesc.p: 1970 issue of RAT from the Periodicals Collection. Cover art by Susan Simensky Bietila.

scopecontent.p: The SSC Periodicals Collection includes over 1,500 titles of current and historical, U.S. and international women's magazines, newsletters, and other serials dating from the 18th century to the present. Among these are Ladies' Companion (1840-1844), Woman's Journal (1870-1916), Lucifer: The Light Bearer (1897-1901), Eugenesia (Mexico, 1943-1945), Church Woman (1943-1949), Black Sash (South Africa, 1958-1972), and popular 20th century magazines such as Vogue (1950-2000) and Cosmopolitan (1953-92). Periodicals of the suffrage and birth control movements, and the mid-twentieth century women's liberation movement are well represented. The latter include titles such as Off Our Backs, Shrew, Rat and Velvet Fist. There are approximately fifty current subscriptions. Holdings range from full-runs to single issues for certain titles. Some titles are on microfilm.

Girl Zines form part of this collection and consist of 9 linear feet (18 boxes) of small, self-published magazines created primarily by young women and girls and share a strong feminist perspective. There is a separate finding aid for the Girl Zines.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research according to the regulations of the Sophia Smith Collection without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be copyrighted. Permission must be obtained from the copyright holders and the Sophia Smith Collection to publish reproductions or quotations beyond "fair use." It is the responsibility of the researcher to identify and satisfy the holders of all copyrights.

prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Periodical Collection, Sophia Smith Collection, Smith College, Northampton, Mass.

altformavail.p: Some issues are on microfilm. Some fragile volumes have been photocopied for preservation purposes.

accruals.p: Regular additions are made to this collection and may not be reflected in this finding aid.

acqinfo.p: The periodicals in this collecion have been donated or purchased from a variety of sources over many years.

relatedmaterial.p: There are many periodicals located in other collections, such as the Margaret Sanger Papers and the Frances Casement Papers. Some are cross-referenced in the list below. See also the extensive list of serials in the YWCA Records, SERIES VI. Publications.
